Key Match Events: Bangladesh restricted South Africa to 113 for six in the Powerplay.
Tanzim Hasan and Taskin Ahmed’s Powerplay burst limited South Africa to 113 for six.
Towhid Hridoy and Mahmudullah took the fight deep but were dismissed to secure South Africa's victory.
Keshav Maharaj defended 10 runs in the final over to help South Africa beat Bangladesh by four runs.
South Africa recorded the lowest total successfully defended in T20 World Cup history at 113/6.
Pre-Game Insights: Bangladesh ended a 17-year drought when they beat Sri Lanka on Saturday.
Bangladesh have never beaten South Africa in T20Is.
South Africa's decision to bat first may have misfired in hindsight.
Bangladesh bowlers were on the mark in the Powerplay, led by Tanzim Hasan and Taskin Ahmed.
Bangladesh did not allow South Africa to dominate at the death as Taskin and Rishad Hossain snapped up the crucial wickets.
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa's win will put them firmly in the driver’s seat for a Super Eight spot.
Heinrich Klaasen expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win.
The win gave South Africa big confidence to the boys.
Win will give South Africa big confidence to the boys.
